basics.name: Mrinal Subash
basics.label: Graduate student
basics.summary: I am studying for my Master's in Bioinformatic at Northeastern University. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2021.

courses: Computational Methods-1, Computational Methods-2 , Statistics for Bioinformatics,Bioinformatics Programming

work.summary: Worked in te Foodome Project Team to implement xconcepts of Network Sciences
highlights: Perform coding in Python to work with datasets tht include USDA, PubChem and PubMed
Implemented WebScraping using the Google maps API
•    Undertook the Automation and Control Engineering course at the University where courses included Vehicle Dynamics, Automation in Energy Systems and Production Systems Control.
•    Attained a grade of 30/30 for all the courses.
•    Got opportunity to talk to one of Ferrari’s Vehicle Dynamics team head, Marco Fainello.

•    A deep learning where the system detects diseases with diabetic retinopathy and classifies them into 4 stages-mild, non-proliferative, proliferative and malignant using Keras, a high-level network API with backend as TensorFlow, written in Python.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.

Interests: Travel, photography, music, philosophy, volunteering at Terra Society, member of the Northeastern University Sanskriti group, member of the NEURONS.
